newsitem.title: CHINA: China establishes ties with Pacific's Cook Islands.
newsitem.headline: China establishes ties with Pacific's Cook Islands.

text.p: China has won a new diplomatic partner, establishing relations with the Cook Islands, the Xinhua news agency said on Saturday.
Ties at the at ambassadorial level took effect on Friday, following a ceremony in Wellington, New Zealand, Xinhua said.
The two sides issued a communique under which the Pacific Cook Islands pledged to recognise the communist state as the only government of China.

"The Cook Islands recognises the government of the People's Republic of China as the sole legal government of China and it reaffirms the long-standing policy not to enter into official relations with Taiwan in any form," it said.
China has regarded Taiwan as a renegade province without the right to engage in international relations since the island split from the mainland after the Nationalists lost the civil war in 1949.
The Cook Islands had not previously recognised Taiwan, which has diplomatic relations with only 30 countries.
